question_text: Which of the following are potential causes for repeated Bluetooth disconnections? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Low battery on one of the devices
Device too close to an access point
correct_answer: Low battery on one of the devices
explanation: Bluetooth shares spectrum with 2.4 GHz devices and may experience interference. Low power or outdated firmware can also cause instability. Proximity to an access point doesnâ€™t inherently disrupt Bluetooth unless there's interference.
